page.title: 02CROOKHAM VILLAGE
page.content: The population of Crookham Village is 697 persons on a broad social basis of mixed age groups from young families to retired people. Crookham Village was given its name in 1952 and the main street comprises a ribbon development of residential homes, ranging from Grade 2 listed buildings to modern houses erected in 1964. The major part of the main street is in a conservation area and an 18th century forge still stands by the roadside. The local Parish Council is responsible for footpaths, rights of way, street lighting and recommends on planning matters.
